comment: Another picture that is worth a thousand words. She is at an orphanage in Kenya in this photo. The kids wanted to pray for her. This is a FIRST LADY - This is Our st Lady of the United States of America and I am proud to share Amen
amr:
# ::snt Another picture that is worth a thousand words. She is at an orphanage in Kenya in this photo. The kids wanted to pray for her. This is a FIRST LADY - This is Our st Lady of the United States of America and I am proud to share Amen
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (p / picture
            :mod (a / another)
            :ARG1-of (w / worth-01
                  :ARG2 (w2 / word
                        :quant 1000)))
      :snt2 (o / orphanage
            :location (c / country
                  :name (n / name
                        :op1 "Kenya"))
            :location (p2 / photo
                  :mod (t / this)))
      :snt3 (w3 / want-01
            :ARG0 (k / kid)
            :ARG1 (p3 / pray-01
                  :ARG0 k
                  :beneficiary (s / she)))
      :snt4 (l / lucky
            :ord (o2 / ordinal-entity
                  :value 1)
            :domain (t2 / this))
      :snt5 (a2 / and
            :op1 (p4 / person
                  :name (n2 / name
                        :op1 "Our"
                        :op2 "St"
                        :op3 "Lady"
                        :op4 "of"
                        :op5 "the"
                        :op6 "United"
                        :op7 "States"
                        :op8 "of"
                        :op9 "America")
                  :domain (t3 / this))
            :op2 (p5 / pride-01
                  :ARG0 (ii / i)
                  :ARG1 (s2 / share-01
                        :ARG0 ii
                        :ARG1 (p6 / person
                              :name (n3 / name
                                    :op1 "Amer Amen"))))))

comment: It's your right to feel they are bad people. And thank you for the Israel clarification. I'm sure a lot of people didn't realize that.
amr:
# ::snt It's your right to feel they are bad people. And thank you for the Israel clarification. I'm sure a lot of people didn't realize that.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (r / right-05
            :ARG1 (y / you)
            :ARG2 (f / feel-02
                  :ARG0 y
                  :ARG1 (p / person
                        :ARG1-of (b / bad-07)
                        :domain (t / they))))
      :snt2 (a / and
            :op2 (t2 / thank-01
                  :ARG0 (ii / i)
                  :ARG1 (y2 / you)
                  :ARG2 (c / clarify-10
                        :ARG0 y2
                        :ARG1 (c2 / country
                              :name (n / name
                                    :op1 "Israel")))))
      :snt3 (s / sure-02
            :ARG0 ii
            :ARG1 (r2 / realize-01
                  :polarity -
                  :ARG0 (p2 / person
                        :quant (l / lot))
                  :ARG1 (t3 / that))))

comment: Please try to use less hateful language to get your point across.
amr:
# ::snt Please try to use less hateful language to get your point across.
(t / try-01
      :polite +
      :mode imperative
      :ARG0 (y / you)
      :ARG1 (u / use-01
            :ARG0 y
            :ARG1 (l / language
                  :ARG0-of (h / hate-01
                        :ARG2-of (h2 / have-degree-91
                              :ARG1 l
                              :ARG3 (l2 / less))))
            :ARG2 (g / get-04
                  :ARG0 y
                  :ARG1 (a / across
                        :domain (p / point-04
                              :ARG0 y)))))

comment: Use of hateful language regarding race and gender is unnecessary and unintelligent.
amr:
# ::snt Use of hateful language regarding race and gender is unnecessary and unintelligent.
(a / and
      :op1 (n / need-01
            :polarity -
            :ARG1 (u / use-01
                  :ARG1 (l / language
                        :ARG0-of (h / hate-01)
                        :topic (a2 / and
                              :op1 (r / race)
                              :op2 (g / gender)))))
      :op2 (ii / intelligent-01
            :polarity -
            :ARG1 u))
